I have PowerShell installed through Snap. It updated two days ago, and now when I open `pwsh` (resolves to `/snap/bin/pwsh`), the process just segfaults after three seconds. This did not happen on 6.2.1.

# Steps to reproduce
Just open PowerShell and wait three seconds.
```bash
$ time pwsh
PowerShell 7.0.0
Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

https://aka.ms/powershell
Type 'help' to get help.

PS /home/iinuwa> Segmentation fault (core dumped)

real	0m3.380s
user	0m0.553s
sys	0m0.079s
iinuwa@localhost:~$

```

# Expected behavior
PowerShell should remain open.

# Actual behavior
PowerShell crashes after three seconds.
# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
PS /home/iinuwa> $psversiontable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.0
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.0
OS                             Linux 5.3.0-40-generic #32~18.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Mon Feb 3 14:05:59 UTC 2020
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

PS /home/iinuwa> Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```
Snap Information

> snap info powershell

comments.body: Just tested installing PowerShell 7.0.0-1ubuntu with the .deb package, and that works just fine.

comments.author: fernandreu
comments.body:
I have the exact same issue with Ubuntu 19.10 when using that same snap package.

It seems it is discussed here with a potential fix (that works for me): https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell-Snap/issues/52

title: PowerShell 7.0 Snap segfaults after three seconds on Ubuntu 18.04
